verses.esv: 5 Then he said, “Do not come near; take your sandals off your feet, for the place on which you are standing is holy ground.”
verses.kjv: 5 And he said, Draw not nigh hither: put off thy shoes from off thy feet, for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.
verses.niv: 5 "Do not come any closer," God said. "Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy ground."

verses.esv: 15 and, as shoes for your feet, having put on the readiness given by the gospel of peace.
verses.kjv: 15 And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace;
verses.niv: 15 and with your feet fitted with the readiness that comes from the gospel of peace.

verses.esv: 33 Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take off the sandals from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.
verses.kjv: 33 Then said the Lord to him, Put off thy shoes from thy feet: for the place where thou standest is holy ground.
verses.niv: 33 "Then the Lord said to him, 'Take off your sandals; the place where you are standing is holy ground.

verses.esv: 15 And how are they to preach unless they are sent? As it is written, “How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the good news!”
verses.kjv: 15 And how shall they preach, except they be sent? as it is written, How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things!
verses.niv: 15 And how can they preach unless they are sent? As it is written, "How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!"

verses.esv: 7 Now this was the custom in former times in Israel concerning redeeming and exchanging: to confirm a transaction, the one drew off his sandal and gave it to the other, and this was the manner of attesting in Israel.
verses.kjv: 7 Now this was the manner in former time in Israel concerning redeeming and concerning changing, for to confirm all things; a man plucked off his shoe, and gave it to his neighbour: and this was a testimony in Israel.
verses.niv: 7 (Now in earlier times in Israel, for the redemption and transfer of property to become final, one party took off his sandal and gave it to the other. This was the method of legalizing transactions in Israel.)

verses.esv: 15 And the commander of the LORD’s army said to Joshua, “Take off your sandals from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy.” And Joshua did so.
verses.kjv: 15 And the captain of the LORD’S host said unto Joshua, Loose thy shoe from off thy foot; for the place whereon thou standest is holy. And Joshua did so.
verses.niv: 15 The commander of the LORD's army replied, "Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy." And Joshua did so.

verses.esv: 16 John answered them all, saying, “I baptize you with water, but he who is mightier than I is coming, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.kjv: 16 John answered, saying unto them all, I indeed baptize you with water; but one mightier than I cometh, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire:
verses.niv: 16 John answered them all, "I baptize you with water. But one more powerful than I will come, the thongs of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.

verses.esv: 17 Sigh, but not aloud; make no mourning for the dead. Bind on your turban, and put your shoes on your feet; do not cover your lips, nor eat the bread of men.”
verses.kjv: 17 Forbear to cry, make no mourning for the dead, bind the tire of thine head upon thee, and put on thy shoes upon thy feet, and cover not thy lips, and eat not the bread of men.
verses.niv: 17 Groan quietly; do not mourn for the dead. Keep your turban fastened and your sandals on your feet; do not cover the lower part of your face or eat the customary food of mourners."

verses.esv: 22 But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring quickly the best robe, and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet.
verses.kjv: 22 But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet:
verses.niv: 22 "But the father said to his servants, 'Quick! Bring the best robe and put it on him. Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.

verses.esv: 7 And he preached, saying, “After me comes he who is mightier than I, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and untie.
verses.kjv: 7 And preached, saying, There cometh one mightier than I after me, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.
verses.niv: 7 And this was his message: "After me will come one more powerful than I, the thongs of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and untie.

verses.esv: 21 For to this you have been called, because Christ also suffered for you, leaving you an example, so that you might follow in his steps.
verses.kjv: 21 For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:
verses.niv: 21 To this you were called, because Christ suffered for you, leaving you an example, that you should follow in his steps.

verses.esv: 11 “I baptize you with water for repentance, but he who is coming after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.kjv: 11 I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost, and with fire:
verses.niv: 11 "I baptize you with water for repentance. But after me will come one who is more powerful than I, whose sandals I am not fit to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.

verses.esv: 10 I clothed you also with embroidered cloth and shod you with fine leather. I wrapped you in fine linen and covered you with silk.
verses.kjv: 10 I clothed thee also with broidered work, and shod thee with badgers’ skin, and I girded thee about with fine linen, and I covered thee with silk.
verses.niv: 10 I clothed you with an embroidered dress and put leather sandals on you. I dressed you in fine linen and covered you with costly garments.

verses.esv:
6   that we may buy the poor for silver
    and the needy for a pair of sandals
    and sell the chaff of the wheat?”
verses.kjv: 6 That we may buy the poor for silver, and the needy for a pair of shoes; yea, and sell the refuse of the wheat?
verses.niv: 6 buying the poor with silver and the needy for a pair of sandals, selling even the sweepings with the wheat.

verses.esv:
6 Thus says the LORD:

  “For three transgressions of Israel,
    and for four, I will not revoke the punishment,
  because they sell the righteous for silver,
    and the needy for a pair of sandals—
verses.kjv: 6 Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they sold the righteous for silver, and the poor for a pair of shoes;
verses.niv: 6 This is what the LORD says: "For three sins of Israel, even for four, I will not turn back {my wrath}. They sell the righteous for silver, and the needy for a pair of sandals.

verses.esv: 13 These wineskins were new when we filled them, and behold, they have burst. And these garments and sandals of ours are worn out from the very long journey.”
verses.kjv: 13 And these bottles of wine, which we filled, were new; and, behold, they be rent: and these our garments and our shoes are become old by reason of the very long journey.
verses.niv: 13 And these wineskins that we filled were new, but see how cracked they are. And our clothes and sandals are worn out by the very long journey."

verses.esv:
27   None is weary, none stumbles,
    none slumbers or sleeps,
  not a waistband is loose,
    not a sandal strap broken;
verses.kjv: 27 None shall be weary nor stumble among them; none shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken:
verses.niv: 27 Not one of them grows tired or stumbles, not one slumbers or sleeps; not a belt is loosened at the waist, not a sandal thong is broken.

verses.esv:
133   Keep steady my steps according to your promise,
    and let no iniquity get dominion over me.
verses.kjv: 133 Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
verses.niv: 133 Direct my footsteps according to your word; let no sin rule over me.

verses.esv: 8 So when the redeemer said to Boaz, “Buy it for yourself,” he drew off his sandal.
verses.kjv: 8 Therefore the kinsman said unto Boaz, Buy it for thee. So he drew off his shoe.
verses.niv: 8 So the kinsman-redeemer said to Boaz, "Buy it yourself." And he removed his sandal.

verses.esv: 5 I have led you forty years in the wilderness. Your clothes have not worn out on you, and your sandals have not worn off your feet.
verses.kjv: 5 And I have led you forty years in the wilderness: your clothes are not waxen old upon you, and thy shoe is not waxen old upon thy foot.
verses.niv: 5 During the forty years that I led you through the desert, your clothes did not wear out, nor did the sandals on your feet.

verses.esv: 4 Carry no moneybag, no knapsack, no sandals, and greet no one on the road.
verses.kjv: 4 Carry neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes: and salute no man by the way.
verses.niv: 4 Do not take a purse or bag or sandals; and do not greet anyone on the road.

verses.esv: 5 with worn-out, patched sandals on their feet, and worn-out clothes. And all their provisions were dry and crumbly.
verses.kjv: 5 And old shoes and clouted upon their feet, and old garments upon them; and all the bread of their provision was dry and mouldy.
verses.niv: 5 The men put worn and patched sandals on their feet and wore old clothes. All the bread of their food supply was dry and moldy.

verses.esv: 11 In this manner you shall eat it: with your belt fastened, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand. And you shall eat it in haste. It is the LORD’s Passover.
verses.kjv: 11 And thus shall ye eat it; with your loins girded, your shoes on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and ye shall eat it in haste: it is the LORD’S passover.
verses.niv: 11 This is how you are to eat it: with your cloak tucked into your belt, your sandals on your feet and your staff in your hand. Eat it in haste; it is the LORD's Passover.

verses.esv:
25   Your bars shall be iron and bronze,
    and as your days, so shall your strength be.
verses.kjv: 25 Thy shoes shall be iron and brass; and as thy days, so shall thy strength be.
verses.niv: 25 The bolts of your gates will be iron and bronze, and your strength will equal your days.

verses.esv: 23 that I would not take a thread or a sandal strap or anything that is yours, lest you should say, ‘I have made Abram rich.’
verses.kjv: 23 That I will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet, and that I will not take any thing that is thine, lest thou shouldest say, I have made Abram rich:
verses.niv: 23 that I will accept nothing belonging to you, not even a thread or the thong of a sandal, so that you will never be able to say, 'I made Abram rich.'
